question_text: A technician wants to ensure a successful and bootable transfer from an old laptop HDD to a new SSD. Select two practices that help ensure the migration works.
answer_options: Defragment the old HDD before cloning
Disable BitLocker or other encryption before cloning
Use the SSD manufacturer’s proprietary cloning software
Change the file system from NTFS to FAT32 before imaging
Enable RAID in BIOS for the SSD
correct_answer: Disable BitLocker or other encryption before cloning
Use the SSD manufacturer’s proprietary cloning software
explanation: Encryption must be disabled for cloning to access sectors properly. Manufacturer-provided tools are optimized for compatibility and bootability.
